trans-unit.source: as an ACS Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: as an ACS Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: <token>firstref_acs</token> supports federation with Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: <token>firstref_acs</token> supports federation with Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: as an identity provider using the OpenID 2.0 authentication protocol.
trans-unit.target: as an identity provider using the OpenID 2.0 authentication protocol.

trans-unit.source: There are no prerequisites that you must complete before you can add Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: There are no prerequisites that you must complete before you can add Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: as an identity provider in an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: as an identity provider in an <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: In the context of <token>secondref_acs</token>, Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: In the context of <token>secondref_acs</token>, Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: is a preconfigured identity provider.
trans-unit.target: is a preconfigured identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Configuring with the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Configuring with the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: You have to configure the following settings when you add Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: You have to configure the following settings when you add Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: as an identity provider using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal:
trans-unit.target: as an identity provider using the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Login link text</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the text that is displayed for the Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Login link text</embeddedLabel>—Specifies the text that is displayed for the Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: identity provider on the login page of your web application.
trans-unit.target: identity provider on the login page of your web application.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Image URL (optional)</embeddedLabel>—Associates a URL with an image file (for example, a logo of your choice) that you can display as the login link for this identity provider. This logo automatically appears on the default login page for your <token>secondref_acs</token>-aware web application, as well as in your web application’s JSON feed that you can use to render a custom login page. If you do not specify an image URL, then a text login link for this identity provider is displayed on the login page of your web application. If you specify an image URL, it is strongly recommended that it be pointed to a trusted source, for example, your own web site or application, using HTTPS to prevent browser security warnings. Also, any image that is larger than 240 pixels in width and 40 pixels in height is automatically resized on the default ACS home realm discovery page. To download a login image for Yahoo!, see <externalLink><linkText>Yahoo! OpenId Buttons</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=214049</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=214049).
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Image URL (optional)</embeddedLabel>—Associates a URL with an image file (for example, a logo of your choice) that you can display as the login link for this identity provider. This logo automatically appears on the default login page for your <token>secondref_acs</token>-aware web application, as well as in your web application’s JSON feed that you can use to render a custom login page. If you do not specify an image URL, then a text login link for this identity provider is displayed on the login page of your web application. If you specify an image URL, it is strongly recommended that it be pointed to a trusted source, for example, your own web site or application, using HTTPS to prevent browser security warnings. Also, any image that is larger than 240 pixels in width and 40 pixels in height is automatically resized on the default ACS home realm discovery page. To download a login image for Yahoo!, see <externalLink><linkText>Yahoo! OpenId Buttons</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=214049</linkUri></externalLink> (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=214049).

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Relying party application</embeddedLabel>—Specifies all existing relying party applications that you want to associate with the Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Relying party application</embeddedLabel>—Specifies all existing relying party applications that you want to associate with the Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: identity provider.
trans-unit.target: identity provider.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: After an identity provider is associated with a relying party application, rules for that identity provider must be generated or added manually in a relying party application’s rule group to complete the configuration.
trans-unit.target: After an identity provider is associated with a relying party application, rules for that identity provider must be generated or added manually in a relying party application’s rule group to complete the configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: Supported claim types
trans-unit.target: Supported claim types

trans-unit.source: After a user authenticates with an identity provider, they receive a token populated with identity claims.
trans-unit.target: After a user authenticates with an identity provider, they receive a token populated with identity claims.

trans-unit.source: Claims are pieces of information about the user, such as an email address or a unique ID.
trans-unit.target: Claims are pieces of information about the user, such as an email address or a unique ID.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> can pass these claims directly through to the relying party application or make authorization decisions based on the values they contain.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> can pass these claims directly through to the relying party application or make authorization decisions based on the values they contain.

trans-unit.source: By default, claims types in <token>secondref_acs</token> are uniquely identified using a URI for compliance with the SAML token specification.
trans-unit.target: By default, claims types in <token>secondref_acs</token> are uniquely identified using a URI for compliance with the SAML token specification.

trans-unit.source: These URIs are also used to identity claims in other token formats.
trans-unit.target: These URIs are also used to identity claims in other token formats.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the claim types that are available to <token>secondref_acs</token> from Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the claim types that are available to <token>secondref_acs</token> from Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: Claim Type
trans-unit.target: Claim Type

trans-unit.source: URI
trans-unit.target: URI

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name Identifier
trans-unit.target: Name Identifier

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/nameidentifier

trans-unit.source: A unique identifier for the user account, provided by Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: A unique identifier for the user account, provided by Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/name
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/name

trans-unit.source: The display name for the user account, provided by Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: The display name for the user account, provided by Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: Email Address
trans-unit.target: Email Address

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2005/05/identity/claims/emailaddress

trans-unit.source: The email address for the user account, provided by Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: The email address for the user account, provided by Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: http://schemas.microsoft.com/accesscontrolservice/2010/07/claims/IdentityProvider
trans-unit.target: http://schemas.microsoft.com/accesscontrolservice/2010/07/claims/IdentityProvider

trans-unit.source: A claim provided by <token>secondref_acs</token> that tells the relying party application that the user authenticated using the default Yahoo!
trans-unit.target: A claim provided by <token>secondref_acs</token> that tells the relying party application that the user authenticated using the default Yahoo!

trans-unit.source: identity provider.
trans-unit.target: identity provider.

trans-unit.source: The value of this claim is visible in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal via the <ui>Realm</ui> field in the <ui>Edit Identity Provider</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: The value of this claim is visible in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal via the <ui>Realm</ui> field in the <ui>Edit Identity Provider</ui> page.
